Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of Border Patrol agents per square mile in Arizona.
Understate: The claim understates the actual number of Border Patrol agents per square mile in Arizona.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide accurate information or evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of Border Patrol agents per square mile is the only relevant measure of border security.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the distribution of Border Patrol agents along the border.
